content: v 1 0 the species tangled bliss scientifically known as vortexia enigma is an alpine flowering plant renowned for its intricate and spiral-like flower structure its name re- flects the way its vibrant blooms seem to intertwine and spiral giving the impression of a tan- gled web appearance the plant produces striking flowers that come in a range of colours from deep indigo to brilliant red each flower has a unique twisted petal arrangement which creates a mesmerizing tangled visual effect the plant typically grows to a height of about 30 centime- tres 12 inches and has slender evergreen leaves that form a rosette at the base habitat vortexia enigma is native to high-altitude alpine meadows and rocky slopes it thrives in the harsh cool climates found at elevations between 2 500 and 3 500 metres 8 200 to 11 500 feet this flower is adapted to withstand extreme temperature fluctuations and strong winds often growing in well-drained stony soils if you have any questions or want to point out possible errors please e-mail me at this address the nerd knits@gmx de i would be very happy if you could tag me on instagram when showing these socks @the nerd knits happy knitting annette 1 materials yarn i used opal sock yarn 420 m or 460 yards / 100 g in three colours for sock #1 #9937 silver as c1 / #5180 red as c2 / #2619 black as c3 the three colours should have a good contrast to the others i recommend using solid colours needed quantities 80 g in c1 60 g of both c2 and c3 needles 2 25 mm / us1 needles for the colourwork section you might want to use a needle size smaller for the cuff if you knit brioche loosely gauge colourwork with ladderback 31 stitches per 10 cm / 4 35 row per 10 cm / 4 sole 34 stitches per 10 cm / 4 36 row per 10 cm / 4 abbreviations brk brioche-knit brp brioche-purl c1 c2 c3 colour 1 colour 2 colour 3 k knit k2tog knit two stitches together lb ladderback m1 make 1 stitch by creating a backward loop p purl p2tog purl two stitches together rs right side sl1 slip 1 ssk slip 1 stitch as if to knit slip another stitch as if to knit transfer both stitches back to the left-hand needle then knit them together through the back loop ws wrong side yo yarn over 2 used techniques brioche here s a tutorial for you https // youtu be/u0rq6avfav8 the basic principle of normal brioche 1 09 set-up row two-pass brioche two-pass brioche in the round we always work 3 24 set-up row one-pass brioche two rounds of knitting for one visible round of 6 37 standard row one-pass brioche brioche stitches round 1 with c1 *brk sl1 with yo* - and repeat from * to * round 2 with c2 *sl1 with yo brp* - and repeat from * to * explanation
